alert.note: Alert for Delaware Beaches; Inland Sussex; Kent (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:31PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Sussex and east central Kent Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 531 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Big Stone Beach to near Lewes to near Millsboro. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Millsboro, Lewes, Milton, Dagsboro, Bowers, Henlopen Acres, Big Stone Beach, Cape Henlopen State Park, Long Neck, Dewey Beach and Magnolia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and southern Delaware.
